result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandy L Porter

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandy L Porter in court.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for Brandy L Porter.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in Court for Plea hearing.  Defense requested adjournment of proceedings. Court grants request.  Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

CORRECTION to Repot entry on 10-04-2022:
Justice Point Discharge Report filed in error. Document has been moved to case 22CF286.
Justice Point Discharge Report, filed. Forwarded to Judge for review.

Defendant Brandy L Porter in court.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for Brandy L Porter.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a plea hearing.  Defense requests an adjournment due to defendant having recent contact with psychiatrist and needs additional information on the matter.  Court rescheduled plea hearing as requested.  Court advised defendant that conditions of bail remain in full effect.  Case adjourned to Branch 11, Rm 608 CH.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandy L Porter in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Franco Mineo appeared by Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

OFF THE RECORD:
 Defendant Brandy L Porter in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Alexander James Geocaris on behalf of Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Scheduling conference held. Trial in court on another matter. Defense has received discovery and offer and requests status date.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Brandy L Porter in court with Attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Brandy L Porter in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/8/22 @ 1p
